definition[0]: not as important as something else
example[1]: Cost is the important thing – any benefits for the user are a secondary consideration.
note[0]: be of secondary importance/be a secondary consideration
example[2]: Writing was always secondary to spending time with my family.
definition[1]: shares, stocks etc in companies that are not considered to be the biggest or most important
example[3]: The market for secondary corporate issues was quiet yesterday.
definition[2]: an industry or product that has developed from another industry and uses materials from that larger industry
example[4]: Secondary industries turn products from farming into more useful forms, eg wool into cloth.
definition[3]: trading of shares, bonds etc that have already been ISSUED (=made available and sold for the first time), and which are now available on the market for other investors to buy and sell
example[5]: The primary market has been out-performing the secondary market in terms of value over the past four years.
example[6]: the 300,000 shares in the secondary offering
